Reviews.Title: “without any facility”
Reviews.Author: mahta e
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a piece of junk always there was bad smell in rooms and although in lobby there weren't any facilities in rooms, no water for drinking and no pots for hot water and..... while we changed our rooms, unfortunatley we lost one pair slippers and one jacket and nobody return them, where they mightbe go..........? i wish the mannager read this and thinking about their hotel

Reviews.Title: “NOT good”
Reviews.Author: ShadiALBESS
Reviews.Content: Hello, I have spent three days with friend of mine on this hotel, the feedback that I can give as follows: - Services: WiFi is working well. - Location: very good - Staff: are not friendly or supportive staff [we were waiting an envelope from the embassy we asked them 10 times they said receiving nothing while the envelope was there from early ] - Room: is really small small, but clean - Bathroom: small one - Price: expensive comparing to what we paid. - Food: good. So, generally the hotel is not good, I can NOT recommend it at all [the only good thing is the location] Regards Shadi

Reviews.Title: “Just for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Osamasala
Reviews.Content: If u want a room only for sleeping this hotel is fine, but if u like it for luxury it will be the worst hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Clean one”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed S
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a very good location and clean the room service need to be improved

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JulietJovi
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is idealâ€¦2 mins walk from Taksim however, that the only good thing about the hotel. Beware of the hotel schemes to rip off your money by charging you for minibar items that you did not drink, it happened with me in addition to 4 of the group we have been traveling with. Moreover, we had food stolen from our room. Thatâ€™s not all, as per the hotel rules when you need fresh towels place the old one on the floor to be replaced. Shockingly, we found out that the cleaning lady placed the dirty towels that had been placed on the floor as the new towels!!

Reviews.Title: “i liked it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: ashrafelmehelmy
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice,clean,everyone was nice and tried to help,rooms were very good though a bit small but clean and beds were so comfortable.the bathrooms were good as well maybe a bit small.the breakfast was delicious,.the site of the hotel was perfect 2 min from metro and from taksim square,.its one of the nicest hotels there and the pool is verygood as well.so enjoy ur stay over there everyone

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: imia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the center of Taxin square, so it is easily accessible. Yet, I would not reccommend it for the following reasons: the rooms sre very small and the quality of the beds low. The showers are mal-functioning and too small. The breakfast is limited and there is no room service, moreover you are not allowed to carry a cup of coffee into the room. The personnel speaks horrible english, is quite rude and not helpful. There are much better hotels to choose at the same price. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: awayupnorth
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just fine to stay in, very short walk to Taksim Square, and the walk along Beyoglu is beyond the square. Brunch is a little less than a westerner would want, but adequate. Everyone speaks English, and we had no problems with the room, or anything involved with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BudapestPeter
Reviews.Content: Our group of businessmen has stayed 3 nights in the hotel. The rooms were filthy ,some beds were blood-stained, the carpets were dirty!!! The bathrooms were infected with mildew!!! There was no cleaning of the room after the first night. We ordered half-pension,breakfast was OK,but the dinner was inedible,and the prices of the drinks were crazy.To offer a 0,33 can of local beer for 10 TL - 5 EUR is a bad joke. The hotel is in an pedestrian area,not possible to park nearby,so we had a lot of problems with the transport too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time and money”
Reviews.Author: Iron_ManDubai
Reviews.Content: Its called lion (not allstar lion) locations is perfect but as other reviews says, I do not recommend anyone to go there they will charge you a high price along with Zero service and worst food I ever had.. Please No more lion hotel.. You can only stay when u have no where else to stay at..

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bhannahjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lion Hotel for a grand total of 4 weeks, put up there on a fellowship with 13 others. We ALL found the Lion to be terrible! Noise coming through the walls at all hours of the night and no respite when I finally went down to the desk to complain. The 'breakfast' was a hodge podge of untouchable food and the waiters at dinner acted like they were doing us a favor even being there. It was a miracle when they managed to get our orders right. Cleanliness was average, although the housekeeping staff routinely decided to rearrange the things in our room according to some indecipherable plan in their heads. I will say that it was plenty warm in the beginning of the Istanbul winter, but that was about the only thing this hotel had going for it other than its location in Taxim.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: The_Spectator
Reviews.Content: My family and I were booked at the Lion Hotel in the Taksim area of Istanbul by a travel agent offering great prices. The old adage "you get what you pay for" definitely applied here. The rooms were very small and very, very worn. Stained, ripped wallpaper in the hallways /bedrooms and very dirty floors in the bedroom - carpet didn't look like it was vacuumed in a month. When I was packing my suitcase, my white collared shirt fell on the floor and when I picked it up it was literally full of pubic hair - sorry for the gory details, but that was my experience. The hotel offered free wireless internet, which only had a range that was assessable from the lobby - not the rooms. The breakfast was decent, lots of bread, eggs, coffee, and a sugar drink that was colored orange. This hotel is attached to the Golden Age Hotel (same building), which is in even worse shape than the Lion Hotel. My advice is to stay away from this hotel - it's not clean.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel that i have stayed”
Reviews.Author: harmonymanila
Reviews.Content: the room is not that clean. there were trash left from the previous occupants. some of the staff was rude. we complaint about the air conditioning that our room was hot. the staff who talked to us even got mad and raised his voice. he told us that their air conditioning is not on 24 hrs a day. its only open from 7am to 11am and 7pm to 1am. what kind of a 4 stars hotel that does not have their air conditioning on 24 hrs a day? usually we were awake at 3am due to the room was hot already. we are not comfortable during our stay at lion hotel istanbul. i do not recommend this hotel. there are many hotel in taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: Vivi_Brazil-Germany
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this hotel is 4-star rated! The staff speaks English very poorly, but they are very attentive and try to understand you as best they can (that"s the reason for my rating of the service) the bed is rockhard, the shower is super-small (as is the rest of the bathroom)... Breakfast had sour tasting milk, NO fruit at all and some very strange things that usually belong in a salad (tomatos, cucumber, filled chillys???). The pool on the 8th floor was first said to be closed, then later offered to me as a place were I should wait until going on a tour: the colour of the water is a muddy green as in a very very murky river... iugh! Even the location: ok, there are the benefits of staying somewhere where all other hotels are - namely many restaurants on the same street (however expensive and not really good at all) and the closeness to Istikal Cadesi. But other then that, it is very far from all the sites, so you end up spending a lot on taxis , which drive you in circles through the city and charge whatever they feel like charging... I would love to come back to Istambul, but definitely NOT to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “help me god”
Reviews.Author: omarLybia
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a good location but the room is not clean bad smell ,the service are bad if you ask for some thing you will wait forever the swimingpool as they said very small like a bathroom the area of hotel very noisy the bed is very small why 4 star ? its maximum 2 star after all please dont go there please,please

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: Chickyny
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel on our tour. Everything here was under par. Rooms really could use some renewal. Bathroom old. Water came out reddish until it ran for a while. Gave me start when I went to wash my hands. Thought I was bleeding. Everything very dull. Potted plants in the lobby were dying from neglect. I got a bottle of water and when no one was looking, watered the plants. Cut flowers on the tables were there much too long and they were wilted. Buffet breakfast was just very average. Service was poor at the front desk though one young man was helpful. There is also a dinner /show at a place by the name of Sultanas, about five blocks away. There you can have a choice of entree and drinks. Better than the standard tour dinner /show which consists of just appetizers and drinks. If you are going to stay near Taskim Square, find a better hotel Location was just 600 ft from the funicular in the center of Taskim Square that will take you just a very short distance from the ferry terminal. There you can pick up the ferry, 5.80 TL round trip, and go to the last of the Prince's Islands. Have lunch on the Island right on the water front and take a horse carriage ride to the top of the island and then walk to the Greek Monastery at the top of the hill. No cars on the Island. After a visit to the monastery built in 963, you can have a beer or wine at a little restaurant behind the monastery. If you haven't eaten, you can get a nice meal there too. We walked all the way from the waterfront. Unless you are in very decent condition, take the carriage. The final walk to the top will take everything out of you. Spectacular view from the top. Ferry ride back was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryjoon
Reviews.Content: Wireless internet at lobby which we used, exciting breakfast buffet, did not have friendly staff though, good location for tourists (2 min walk to Taksim, within walking distance to subway). If you want to go around and see Istanbul it is a clean and fair hotel to stay in, if you want to enjoy the hotel I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast selection in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: user47
Reviews.Content: The Lion hotel is 2-3mins walk from Taksim Square Metro and buses and of course Istiklal Caddesi. Lion and Golden age hotels share common 1st and ground floors. I didn't go to the pool but I think that my overall experience of this hotel was pleasant and think it is ok for a 4-star hotel in this price range. Lion hotel was clean, has ensuite facilities I thought the beds were ok, decent pressure from the showers even on 4th floor, you get your own lockable safe in your room. It is very quiet at night at this hotel so I got enough sleep. You get your own minibar in your room - don't bother using it the shop just in front of the hotel is much cheaper. The best part about this hotel was the very good buffet breakfast selection in the mornings which is included in the price. I paid about $80 per night via holidaycity.com for a single room in September which was good for the location. The hotel seems to suit families as well as other travellers. The only complaint that I have with the hotel is that the reception staff prefer to talk amongst themselves instead of serve customers at the desk; but don't let this put you off staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fiasco in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Helenoftroy60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lion Hotel in Istambul from Sept 20/23 2007, the hotel was very run down and dirty, mildew in showers, furniture in bad shape, beds were hard, I still do not know how they got a 4 star rating, the only thing going for it was the location. My advice to all travelers is to read the hotel reviews before you travel.

Reviews.Title: “Concrete beds”
Reviews.Author: DeidreLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but don't chose it if you want comfort and have security concerns. Beds were very hard and uncomfortable, staff on helpdesk overworked so you had to wait for ages to be served some unhelpful or didnt understand what you were saying. One of the very few hotels that demands passports to photocopy but will only give them back in their time. We waited for a day to get ours back and when we asked for the 3rd time they just gave us a pile of ALL the passports they had collected not only could we take any passport we wanted they were just sitting on the front desk where anyone couldve taken them! Be warned.

HotelInfo.Name: Lion Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lamartine Cad No 41 | Taksim, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
